result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Hedrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked, sentence credit to be determined by the jail.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond applied - paid in full.

-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Revoked, sentenced to Co Jail/HOC - 01/25/2022

8:46 AM Defendant Joshua J Hedrick appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Scott Paley Phillips appeared by video for Joshua J Hedrick, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls both cases 2014CM148 and 2016CM116. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via zoom. Court goes over right to appear in person and with his attorney. Defendant has no need to talk with his attorney at this time. Atty Phillips has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions. State has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions. DA confirms victim compliance. Sentencing recommendation by DA Laspisa. Sentencing statement by Atty Phillips. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2014CM148 (count 3) 

-9 months county jail, consecutive to any other sentence. No Huber, out of county service or out of county travel.
-Court orders the court costs of $453.50 on 2014CM148 be reduced to a civil judgment.

 2016CM116 (count 1)

-9 months county jail, consecutive to any other sentence. No Huber, out of county service or out of county travel.

Court grants 223 days of sentence credit to 2014CM148.

Court adjourned at 8:58 AM
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 25, 2022 at 08:45 am. / Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (emailed to Waushara Co Jail)

3:20 P.M.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 3 in 2014CM148 with probation and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in and defendant will plea to count 1 in 2016CM116 with probation and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Wilsnack concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as a repeater and DV.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 3 as charged of 2014CM148 and orders counts 1,2 & 4 be dismissed and read-in and finds the defendant guilty on count 1 of 2016CM116 and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in .  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Wilsnack.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

2014CM148

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.  To be collected by the Clerk of Courts office and is to be paid during the term of probation.  May set up a payment plan.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-DNA Sample.

2016CM116

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.  To be collected by the Clerk of Courts office and is to be paid during the term of probation.  May set up a payment plan.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-DNA sample.

Jail to come up with the sentence credit.

Court orders the cash bonds on file be applied to the court costs.

Court orders defendant to re-pay the costs for court appointed attorney fees.
